revised_title: Hydrogen Atom Recombination Rate Measurement at Room Temperature via ESR Spectroscopy
tldr: The authors used electron spin resonance (ESR) spectroscopy to measure the rate of recombination of hydrogen atoms at room temperature. They analyzed the kinetics of hydrogen atom decay in a gas-flow system and determined the absolute concentrations of hydrogen atoms. The study provided reliable values for the rate constants of the decay processes, including the second-order gas-phase recombination reaction and the first-order surface recombination reaction. No evidence was found for the presence of a third-order gas-phase recombination reaction.
